reviews.review: The crispy pork belly soup lives up to the hype. The broth is seriously delicious. Also, try the Panang crab cakes.
If your waiter introduces himself as "Harry", thank your luck stars. He has complete knowledge of the menu and made the perfect recommendation, Crispy Pork Belly Soup. Simply outstanding.
Everything is delicious but the pork belly soup...mannn
Amazing alternately deep, warm spices, and refreshing bright flavors. Great curries, cocktails, atmosphere.
Go Lao hot at your own risk.

I've never had a bad meal here. I adore the lettuce wraps, and all the soups are good. They are very accommodating for dietary requests, and the cocktails are SO GOOD. Jordan Hester is in charge of that, and he's the man!

The only thing this restaurant lacks is enough tables. Too tough to get a reservation. I'm still thinking about the Crispy Pork Belly Soup and the Crispy Rice Lettuce Wrap. And thinking I want to go back soon!

No need to add to the other reviews here. How much praise can anyone heap on a place? Reviews say it all. First time visit with high expectations. Had lunch. World-class food beautifully plated and presented. Will be back as a priority next time we are in town.
This Place Exceeded Expectations. Ambience Is Great, Service Is Excellent & The Food Is Awesome. Highly Recommended.

Wow. Excellent. Went there for a late Valentines because this was the earliest weekend I could get a reservation. Service was awesome. You can tell hostess and wait staff actually communicate.
I got papaya salad with filet mignon. I promise I'm not trying to sound stuck up but I love a good steak and have been to every "steakhouse" in...
I've been wanting to come here for a while. My work colleague is originally from Laos and highly recommended Bida Manda. So taking a day off this last Friday I took my wife for an early lunch.

I had to come here twice to make sure I wasn't dreaming I love this this I took my boyfriend here on a date because we both love south East Asian cuisine everything is so tempting however do yourself a favor and get:

After reading all the great reviews on Yelp and being an avid Thai food eater, I really want to try this place. We were told the wait would be around 45 minutes on a Tuesday night for table of three, but we were able to get to our table with in 15 minutes so even though we are willing to wait that long, we were happy to be seated sooner than that.
When I was in Raleigh I just knew that I HAD to come here. The reviews are insane and I would soon find out that I would be writing my own 5 star review.

Very nice modern upscale Laotian /Thai restaurant.That pampers their guest with shrimp chips to munch on as customers peruse the menu. After dinner you get a shot of the digestive of the day. Way cool.
The food is good, have been a few times and have enjoyed it every time.
You can't go wrong with anything. I love their Caesar salad with the grit croutons. I always ask for extra croutons!!
Loved the she crab soup! Charleston-esque
Meal was delicious from start to finish.   Fried green tomatoes and arugala salad were a great starter.  The seafood grits was outstanding but very close honorable mention to the catfish.
The Carpet Bagger was excellent. The barnaise sauce is great! For dessert the Pumpkin Bread Pudding was amazing!

We had a small business lunch here. The seating was very satisfactory. The service was very good. The menu is oriented to unique dishes with a southern flair. The meals were excellent. The she crab soup is quite good. The collards are best ever. The sea bass is good. Another unique dish was Caesar salad with crisp oysters.
Loved this spot so much we returned a second night before leaving Raleigh. Terrific food, nice staff and welcoming dcor. The pork tenderloin is not to be missed.

My wife and I and another couple ate at the Grill because it was recommended by a friend. We were not disappointed. The atmosphere was noisy but friendly. The service was exemplary. We all started out with she crab soup, one of my favorites. It was outstanding - rich, creamy and loaded with crab meat. I then had the stuffed...

Such a quaint little nice restaurant. A gem in a small strip center that will not disappoint. I started with the fried green tomatoes with the pimento cheese and they were excellent. For entree I had the pork tenderloin and it was soooooo good, fork tender and with the Brussels sprouts and cauliflower pure that lend just a slight woody...

The dinning experience at the Grill gets better with each visit, Try the Short ribs or the Salmon. My father is a fan of the catfish with a side of grits. He knows catfish!!!
Chad at the bar is a treasure. You never leave a stranger.
The only 5 star establishment I dined at in the triangle.

We made reservations for Glenwood Grill for Valentine's Day and we left very satisfied with our experience. I would definitely recommend Glenwood Grill for a romantic date night. It is a smaller restaurant, which makes it feel cozier. However, depending on where your table is, you could end up being pretty close to your neighbors. This doesn't really bother me too much, but I could see that some other people might get bothered. But for Valentine's Day, I think they planned their reservations to leave plenty of time between seatings. Despite, the tables being close together, it never felt too crowded or loud.

We went to Glenwood Grill for Valentines Day and the food and service were just fantastic. The food was contemporary American, and everything was cooked amazingly well. We started with the oyster Rockefeller dip, and it came with four succulent, fried oysters over a creamy and cheesy spinach dipped served with flat bread. The fried oysters were huge, juicy, and flash fried perfectly without drying them out. The spinach dip was super creamy and cheesy. Definitely not healthy, but tasted amazing with the flat bread.
"Delicious gourmet food & preparation in a Glenwood Ave. strip mall"

The Glenwood Grill. Wonderful place. I moved into my new home a few miles North off of Glenwood and would sometimes shop at the Harris Teeter that is in the same strip mall plaza. I used to see the Glenwood Grill and thought that I would eventually go by to see the fare. Great food. Good ambiance. Small intimate feel to the restaurant. Romantic. I cannot wait to get a girlfriend or a significant other to bring here. Which goes to my first point of why this place is so great...
I had sushi but 3 friends raved about the burgers!
Bento boxes are the best, gives you the best of both worlds.
Bento box is great way to have sushi and burger. You can customize EVERYTHING, which is not the of the Orlando Cowfish.
Expensive but good. Interesting food fusion between burger and sushi.
Excellent food, and while the wait can be a bit longer than expected its worthwhile. Only one remark for the sashimi slices...2 big!!!
Really creative fusion with a decent drink menu as well. I love that I can get a sushi roll and mini burgers in the same meal!

I had a hard time understanding the concept of a restaurant that specialized in hamburgers AND sushi. And yes, there is hamburger sushi. I had to have that; because where else are you going to get something like that. It was surprisingly delicious.
The ambiance of the restaurant is also one-of-a-kind. While you are waiting for a table, there is...

My husband and I went the other day. Luckily for us it was an off hour so we were seated immediately and the place was almost empty. Our waiter was very attentive and helpful...showing us the menu as we have never been there before. I took the waiter's suggestion and got the burger with the short ribs on it. Yum!!...

I've been here twice and both times the service and the food was divine! Portions are very large. Be prepared to take a doggy bag. They have a lamb burger that is delicious. There is a bar area and a large fish tank with beautiful fish swimming around. Wait staff are well trained and present themselves professionally.

The food was top notch, the ambiance was inviting, our waiter was super friendly, and the food did not take too long. It was cooked beautifully, it had the right texture, and it should be in the top 10 on Trip Advisor.

The mysterious cowfish was always ridiculously packed with people so I've stayed away until last night. Arrives around 630. As expected its packed. Wifey, who does not like to wait gives me the negative Nancy again after letting me choose tknights restaurant.
I'll admit it : I was skeptical. A place that can do both sushi and burgers well? Sushi in North Carolina? The Cowfish can deliver!
Fresh, Fabulous and Fun.
This place is so much fun, great sushi bar but also a great burger bar for those who may not partake of aforementioned raw fish (am looking at you Mindy M.). Great and knowledgeable service, too

I was sceptical about going here @ 1st , my wife wanted to take me on a date (Thursday Night) I was like WOOOW , PPl go out on a thursday night This place is "PACKED" and we had a 45 min wait , although it only took like 20 mins and the Food is amazing , Burgers & Sushi - Who Knew ???? But overall the atmosphere is very lively & energetic , try this place out !!!!!!!
Great food and the service is good too!
This is the best Chinese restaurant in the area. Love the food here.
The lunch special combo is a great deal! An entree, rice/noodles, and an egg roll for $6.25. Make sure to try their sesame chicken!
Green curry is awesome. String bean chicken extra spicy off the lunch specials.
Excellent Thai and Chinese. Best in Raleigh
Small and quaint with consistently great food on each visit. Great for lunch, dinner or take out. Much needed in the area.
We went to Red Pepper Asian based of the reviews. The food was great and everyone was very friendly. I will definitely be back. They have the freshest tasting egg rolls I've every had.

The Red Pepper is the Fortune Palace reborn. The Red Pepper is smaller than the Fortune Palace, but the owner and staff are very accommodating. Those that call the Red Pepper an"American" version of Chinese food don't know how to order. I entertained people from China at the Fortune Palace, they didn't want to go anywhere else.

If you ever tried the Fortune Palace on Capital and you liked it, then you'll love this place. Fortune palace owners sold their business a few years ago and recently just opened this much smaller version. Menu is smaller, not as much selection but still very good. The Calamari is very popular because they use Cuttlefish instead of regular Squid....

Thank god I had google maps to get me there, otherwise I would not have found it. When I got there, the parking lot was empty but it quickly filled up. The food was standard american versions of Chinese food, which was tasty and satisfactory, but I will probably try to find another Chinese restaurant with more imagination.
This little gem is definitely tucked away. You can't see it from the main street or any street really and the only way I even found out about it was from other reviewers.

Tucked away in an area far far away...in Raleigh. This is a hidden gem on New Bern Avenue in a quite shopping area. The inside is well decorated and clean. The menu is unique with just the perfect number of items to choose from.
I've been to Red Pepper about 10 times and have never been disappointed with the quality of the food or the service. Both are top-rate.
The place is clean & the staff is very friendly.

A really good Chinese restaurant in East Raleigh Considering that much of this area is filled with walmarts, chain restaurants and general sketchiness, I was shocked to find this place. Don't be deterred by the strip mall location-it's actually really cute inside and the food is awesome.
Wonderful crab cakes and pizza!!
Pizza. Salad. Sandwiches. You really can't go wrong here.
Savory food. Beware of cross contamination, they are not careful. I have dairy and nut allergies and left with an inflamed face after the meal.
The bartenders are mixing some great cocktails like "Saving Grace" and "The Last Word".  Crunchy potato & arugula salad is my favorite on the menu.  Can't wait to come back and try the pizzas.
Brick oven broccoli, cast iron goat cheese (ask for extra bread), spicy sausage & black pepper honey pizza finish with chocolate budino.... amazing

I'm going to be honest, I'm a pain in the butt when it comes to restaurants. I'm rarely every happy or enthusiastic but our meal here was one of the best ones we have had all year. As a chain, it pains me to be so enthusiastic but literally every dish that every one of us got was great! Service...

This is a good casual dining restaurant. They have a short menu selection. We each had the wood fired pizzas. Each was good. The sausage, cheese and honey was really good. They have a nice craft beer menu. The wine menu is limited but is has Murillo choices at a fair price. The decor is very open; a bit noisy...

Food was really good - especially the melted goat cheese in a skillet. Service was average, but in fairness the restaurant was packed. Not a great place to have conversation - super noisy - but if you like to be in the middle of everything, then it's a great choice!

Tazza Kitchen occupies the old Cafe Cartura that used to be in Cameron Village. There are some interesting similarities but doesn't really hold a flame to it. A friendly waitress pours you some bottled water just like the old place. Gone are the glorious meat and cheese plates, sandwiches, and vast kaleidoscope of menu items. Here the menu is very...
The food was fantastic. The Brussels Sprorts were so good. We have been there several times. Love the food atmosphere Everything. Can't wait to go back
Spectacular dinner everything we ordered was super delicious ... We must comeback pizza

This is one of my absolute favorite restaurants, and I will always return. With that said, I had a really bad experience on my birthday this past November, and I'm not sure it was handled in the best manner.

Ended up here before a night out. Likely just reiterating what's already been said countless times but the sprouts held their own as an app, polenta was phenomenal and the pizza the lady got had a pretty admirable amount of flavors going on too.

I FINALLY got to try the Spicy Sausage and Black Pepper Honey pizza that everyone has been raving about! If other restaurants are smart, they'll start having honey as a toppings option also. The contrast between the spicy sausage and the black pepper with the sweet honey worked amazingly. Another thing that I really like about Tazza's pizzas is that they have very thin crusts. It makes the pizza not too filling and I don't feel like I'm in a food coma when I finish, unlike my experiences at most pizza places. I wouldn't recommend these pizzas for sharing, unless you are ordering some other items, because of this reason (And also because it is just too good to share). But another thing with them having such a thin crust, is that the weight of the toppings and cheese overpower it a bit, so the crust went somewhat limp. But it really does taste amazing.

I went based on yelp reviews, and I'm glad I did. It's low key enough not to intimidate me with it's trendyness, I showed up in jeans and felt fine. Had the guacamole which was a little over limed for my taste and plain (a dollop of Pico also basic) and served with naan style large round chips which were terribly hard, I ate it with a fork eventually. Didn't see it worth the price tag. I did have a rum and coke which was tasty, and definitely a decent pour, woo. I went with the suggestions of the spicy sausage and black pepper honey and it was tasty, no regrets. It is wood oven thin crust so if you don't like that style of pizza, don't get it you might be wondering where your sauce is (yay I can taste my toppings) and why your toppings don't go to the crust. The crust was a vehicle, nothing spectacular, but I'd do pizza here if I come back (I'm not from Raleigh). I beat the Saturday night rush, so service seemed good to me.
The pork chop was amazing!!
Wonderful restaurant. The ribeye and cheese grits are outstanding. Great staff too!
Everything I've tried has been superb and fresh. The service is great too!
Expensive but food tastes great
Piri Piri Chicken entree

They just started serving on Sunday this past weekend and I suggest to my wife that we give it a try after church. First of all when you walk in the restaurant, it has a nice airy wide open feel, I like that! Next the people, we were greeted at the door and each of the staff we talked with...
Went out to lunch and the food was great. The atmosphere is wonderful and staff very friendly. The shrimp and grits was scrumptious.
Great menu!! Will be back!! The shrimp and grits were amazing!!!! And service was great! Even got to see how it was cooked in the back!!

This place is a gem. We decided to give it a try after we heard good things about it and we were really happy with our decision. Staff very friendly, our waiter took his time explaining how to use the ordering system and answered all the questions we have. The decoration is beautiful you don't feel like you are on...

My wife and I recently visited this restaurant as part of a special evening together. We came after reading the good reviews. The grilled/smoked theme of the food served here really made us want to give it a try, and we weren't disappointed (for the most part).
I ordered the ribs (which were amazingly tender), and my wife got the...

I have been eying Kamado Grill for a while since the unappealing Lucky 32 was finally replaced near my parents house. With a restaurant advertising most of their cooking on speciality Kamado Joe Grills and a wide variety of tap beers.

I wanted to be amazed. Had seen the coming of Kamodo Grill. Finally the old Lucky 32 was going to be operational again. When friends suggested KG for dinner, I was excited. I checked KG out online. I was a little skeptical but loved the concept. The atmosphere was pleasant enough. Not over the top, simply a clean, modern design. The iPad (menu/ordering system) at the table was pointless. Presented simply as showy especially when the server simply used it as an ordering tool. The server would have been better off with their own tablet as opposed to it being on the table.

I really enjoyed this restaurant. The atmosphere and service is great. I love the idea of ordering from an Ipad and being able to customize your food. I was in the mood for a burger, so the KG burger was an easy choice...I went with a side of the smoked gouda mashed potatoes. If you like spicy, the mashed potatoes are packed with a bunch of flavor. My burger was cooked a perfert medium well, piled high with caramelized onions and pachetta. The weekends are busy here and we has a 45 minute wait, but it's definitely worth. I don't think you can go wrong with any choices from the menu.
We celebrated Valentines at Kamado Grill this evening.
Best german food of my life. Its better than what you probably know german food to be. Throw a dart at the menu, sit back and enjoy.
Pierogies and bratwurst. Don't overthink it.
Any sausage is good. The pierogis are excellent.
Today I had the mushroom and cabbage pierogies as an appetizer, then ordered their classic cheeseburger with a side of fries and a paprika mayo to dip them in. Bang on good!!

Everything is fantastic. Try the pretzels, try the spatzle, try the pierogi, the venison meatballs, dont skip the schnitzel. The desserts are out of this world, as well. I'll be returning to try more!

My husband and I stopped in for lunch while in town for a weekend. I tried the daily special smoked trout salad. It was an amazing mix of flavors that went extremely well together. My husband had a Rueben burger and declared it one of the best burgers he's ever had!

What a fantastic meal!
It is a mix of German and Polish food. I came here with my girlfriend. It has a great atmosphere for a date.
We had the kielbasa starter. It came with sauerkraut, horseradish mustard, and (of course) kielbasa. There might have been something else, but it was all delicious. The horeradish mustard didn't have an overly...

How have we not been here before now? We live just a few miles from J Betski's and last night was our first visit.
We dined with 2 good friends who also traveled with us to Bavaria last year.
We ordered 3 apps: the smoked trout salad, the home made pretzels with pate and the bratwurst stuffed with frois gras....

Fantastic appetizers you will not find anywhere else. We could have eaten a dozen of the pierogi. Two of us had the always delicious pork schnitzel with cucumber salad that is outstanding. Our son ordered the venison meatballs which were amazing. All that plus a top beer selection and can't say no to desserts.
A truly unique restaurant you should...

Had not been to J Betski's in years and had kind of forgotten about it. Decided to return recently with family visiting in town and we not disappointed at all. Great service and delicious cocktails. Food was outstanding. I even went vegetarian and it was wonderful. The mushroom and cabbage pierogis were terrific. I had the vegetable and noodle dish...

We've been to J Betski's a couple of times now and are definitely fans. The first time was on Valentine's Day with a pre-set menu, and the most recent time was just a random date night. Both times, the food and service have been top notch. I'm not sure I would classify J Betski's as a classy or elegant restaurant and feel like going in your jeans on a date night is perfectly fine. There were a couple of tables that were a bit more dressed up, but to be honest, the atmosphere and semi-close quarters do not warrant any type of extra fancy outfit.
I had dinner here a few weeks ago and it was overall a great experience! The service was great, the food was fantastic and the company was good too!
Very, very good. Very small inside but good food. I've been here for lunch and for dinner - I can say dinner is the best. Lunch isn't bad, just not as good as dinner and not as many options.

J. Betski's is a German and Polish and then a touch of modern fusion mixed in. You absolutely have to order the pierogi and they were the best part of the meal. They were filled with pumpkin and cheese and so good we had to order another plate for the table.

We finally visited this restaurant again to celebrate my partner's birthday. Everything we ordered was out-of-this-world amazing! We decided to try the specials today, and ended up getting pan-seared scallops and shrimp, and pork and venison meatballs with spaetzle. The meatballs were by far some of the best I have ever had in my life. My partner and I both agreed that the scallops were ridiculously good. They were so fresh and perfectly cooked! We ended our meal with the famous chocolate bacon torte, and an apple strudel and left very very full and satisfied. J Betski's never disappoints!
Mac and cheese is divine
Fried chicken, cole slaw, biscuits and a local craft beer. Can't go wrong, or ask the staff, they're super friendly and helpful.
Obviously the fried chicken! Chicken biscuit is tops. Chicken & waffle is a strong 2nd. Batter contains honey. Succulent chicken. Sides have different twists on seemingly traditional offerings.
Chicken and waffles are out of this world
The best chicken and waffles I've ever had. Also, their Old Fashioned cocktail was delicious.

Despite the chef's fame, we have found the dining experience less than satisfactory in the past because of indifferent or even condescending staff. So it had been a couple of years since we had been to Beasleys but because we were yearning for fried chicken we recently gave it another try. What an improvement! The fried chicken is good tho...
My favorite time to eat at Beasley's is brunch. Divine! Be prepared to wait for your table. They are usually packed.
I loved the fried chicken and honey drizzle. The side dishes on the other hand were disappointing. The mac and cheese tasted like they used powered cheese and was dry.

Everything, absolutely everything is delicious here. Best chicken, biscuits, and beverages. One of my favorite places in Raleigh. Always jammed packed and its small, but worth it. Great waiters, good prices.
Try it. You will love it too.

Very simple menu with awesome tasting food. Had the veggie plate where you choose 3 side items. I was very satisfy with the three choices of veggies, as they were cooked with care for the detail and very tasty. My husband had the Beasley salad and he loved it too.

Everyone talks about the chicken and waffles here, which makes sense - what a delicious dish that encapsulates so much of what's awesome about Southern cooking - but we need to review three more must-have items from the Beasley's menu.

Beasley's Chicken and Honey is a trendy, downtown Southern-style fried chicken place. Their menu is not really diverse, and it doesn't need to be. You're going to order some very good fried chicken. It's going to be crispy and delicious with a light drizzle of honey, and you are going to love it. You might get it with a waffle, which will also be delicious. The side items rotate a bit based on the season. But regardless, you're going to love them too.
Beasley's was one of the first places I ate in Raleigh when we moved here four years ago, and I think it will always be a favorite..

Fried chicken and waffles is one of weirdest, yet greatest food combinations ever made and Beasley's does it really well. The fried chicken is so crispy and the seasoning in the coating is so good. It really isn't your average fried chicken, and when drizzled with their honey syrup sauce, it's the perfect balance of sweet, salty, and savory. It's almost a must to get the combo with the waffle. The waffle is light and fluffy, and does great to contrast the crispiness of the fried chicken. Just cover everything in that honey sauce and you'll be good to go. They also do a pretty good job with their sides too. I've tried their mac n cheese, and sweet potato sides and both were delicious.The sweet potato sides go great with the honey sauce as well.
Ate at Beasley's this past Sunday. Food+ Service was okay, not much to rave about here.
Nice place and the food is good but very small servings. Was still hungry!
Impressive service
Had the pork shank and it was to die for. Service was just on point. Food was amazing.
This place is hit-and-miss for me, but the she-crab soup is always superb. I wish they would improve their lunch service; it takes way too long to do lunch here on a work day.
Perfect for a special date. The absolute best salmon I've ever had the pleasure of eating. The elderberry cocktail is delightful. The potatoes and spinach were my favorite sides.
If you haven't been to 18 Seaboard, you are missing out on an amazing experience! From the ambiance, to the food, wine and service was incredible! Get the swordfish, you will love every second...

I decided to try 18 Seaboard for dinner to see if that experience would be any better than the brunch. Unfortunately this outing was much much worse and there will not be another visit there based on this dinner.
I ordered the filet mignon, cooked medium, a dish I order at many restaurants. I was served cold, raw steak. If...

We have been going to 18 Seaboard for many years and have never been disappointed. They always have a good variety of dishes at a good price. My wife has to eat gluten-free and has always had several options to choose from. I highly recommend this place.

Well it was Restaurant Week again and 18 Seaboard is a must on our dining for this week. This time was equally sensational. I just love sitting in their round booths. Every thing was great. The service that Jamel provided along with his recommendations made the evening a success. My wife had the Shrimp and Grits and loved it. I...

I have been to 18 Seaboard before for dinner and was here for a business lunch to celebrate the holidays. This is a great place to have a really nice meal. Dinner can be a bit pricey but the food and service is always excellent and the atmosphere is really nice. This is a farm to table restaurant with locally...

My wife and I had the pleasure of visiting 18 Seaboard during the Raleigh food tour. Since we were on the tour we got to meet the executive chef, Serge. We have been on a few food tours in other cities and the chefs are always nice, but it is rare to meet one who has the enthusiasm and desire to take time to talk with his diners as much as Serge.

Restaurant week was our opportunity to dine here for the first time. Regrettably, it will be our only visit. While the reception, service attention and ambiance were exceptional, unfortunately, the food wasn't. Well, there was one service hiccup, where my glass of wine appeared in timely fashion, but the sangria did not...after asking the waitress, it seemed to have been "skipped" by the bartender.
This has to be one of the first in the Triangle to care about bringing us NC products and telling us what those are. Way ahead of times, really. Truly appreciate this restaurant group for that!

Really want to do 4 1/2 stars... Took my wife here during triangle Resturant week. Funny thing, everything we wanted was on the regular menu. So we skipped the specials and went for it. I got the pork shank which is their most popular item and my wife a chicken dish. Both were very pleasing. Dessert were these scrumptious chocolate bourbon truffles. YUMM! here was a treat!! I neglected to mention the brisket tacos. Bananas.... The flavor was intense but ever so pleasing. We will be back

This is quite possibly my favorite restaurant in Raleigh, because I love getting some good ol Southern comfort food! (Even if it is a little fancy.) My favorite meal is the grilled meatloaf and goat cheese potatoes.
My fave is the Shrimp Mango Jalfrezi
Tikka masala
I really love this place. The food was outstanding! Not too crazy about their cocktails though.
Vindaloo, any app, kingfisher and naan to wash it down!  Staff is friendly and knowledgeable, very attentive.
Momos are amazing!!!

The food at Kabab and Curry was delicious. The Bread Basket appetizers with three sauces was outstanding. I could happily have made a meal of it. In fact, we should probably have ordered a second basket (though there were only five of us), because we all enjoyed it so much. I can't say enough good things about the three sauces...

I've been here for both buffet and a la carte ordering for dinner. This is my inside-the-beltline go-to Indian place.
The buffet is pretty good. It's not the largest or the smallest I've been to, but it has a decent selection. There are a couple of sauces, pickled onions, salad, papadum, appetizer (usually pakora), plenty of veg and non-veg options,...

I hosted a small party in Kabab and Curry on Nov 5th, 2015. It was a very special day as I was married that day and Kabab and Curry allowed me to entertain my family and friends on its premises. The owner Mr Tilo is an exceptional manager and host. He especially make sure to make my experience memorable. All...

The food was delicious and the service was very good. Haven't had Nepali and Indian food this good since I was in India and Nepal in the 1980's. The service was really good but not hovering. Goat, lamb and chicken all great, the spice level perfect for those of us who wanted hot, and great for our fellow diner who...

We went to try the lunch buffet, which was delicious; plenty of fresh and hot choices. One thing I will say is that the food could have been a bit spicier, but it was still very good especially for the price! The service was impersonal and uninterested. We waited a long time to get our check. But, we werent drinking...

I have been to this place twice, both times on a Sunday night. Once coming to Raleigh, I have been looking for an authentic Indian eatery and this hands down is my favorite thus far! The past two times I orders the vegetable Samosa's, Palak Paneer, and Garlic Naan and I have not been let down (I even have enough food left over for 3 more meals for the week)!
Food: 4
I've been here for both buffet and a la carte ordering for dinner. This is my inside-the-beltline go-to Indian place.
INDIAN BUFFET, need I say more!

The best Indian/Nepalese restaurant I've tried, and as testament to this it's always packed, especially around lunch. Every thing on their menu is delicious and can be made as spicy or as mild as you want it. I've tried around half the items on their menu. The buffet selection is great and very reasonably priced for the quality of the food. The servers are very nice, but there is a bit of a language barrier depending on who your waiter is. This place has the best naan and rice pudding too. They can also make off-menu items.
Never had a bad experience here. The food, drinks and service are always on point. And they go above and beyond to accommodate my gluten free/dairy free needs.
We decided to eat here after reading all the great reviews. The staff and service were perfect. The food was good ... But not the best in Raleigh. We will definitely eat here again though.
Margaritas & shrimp tacos are the way to go! Absolutely delish!
If GF is a must just ask for corn tortillas and GF chips.  Just as good service and food as the one on leadmine just not as much 'character'
Everything

We made a late reservation (a must) and arrived about 10 minutes early. We waited at least 30 minutes for our table and when we were being seated, the hostess asked us how long we had been waiting because our table had been ready for quite some time but she said they couldn't find us. Huh? She walked past us...

Have been here so many times I can't count. Great food and fun atmosphere. Can be crowded at times but the staff does a wonderful job at turning over tables quickly. The owner is always there and greets tables personally.
I just really didn't care for their menu (though I like tacos) and didn't find it tasty. There are a lot of different Mexican restaurants in the area and ill choose them.

Fun decor; it gets busy & loud so plan accordingly.
Knowledgable, spot-on service (Ashley)
The tamale was delicious *highly recommend*
Talega de plata (Dessert) was amazing

Gonza is our number one go to place for family get-together's and celebrations. While waiting for your food which is always excellent, their chips and salsa can't be beat. The wait staff is always friendly and the atmosphere relaxing. There is also a gluten free menu available upon request. Needless to say, I couldn't recommend them more.

It's in a bit of a dump of a shopping plaza, which made us skeptical, but we gave it a shot. VERY glad we did, because this is easily a new favorite for us. The food is fantastic. We got a chicken quesadilla and a burrito, both were some of the best Mexican we've ever had. Really great atmosphere; very fun place to eat. It fills up fast, so come early or be prepared to wait.
Overpriced
I really wanted to love it, I promise.
Great food and great ambiance. it is a bit pricey for the size of the tacos, but they are excellent.

I've lived in Mexico and Phoenix, so I can claim a fairly high level of knowledge about Mexican food. This place hits the right marks on that score.  If I were commenting on just the food, I'd give it four stars abd would look forward to repeat visits.
All the burgers.
Great burgers and good drink specials. Gets a pretty busy at peak times.
The bacon cheeseburger on steroids is amazingggggg
Some of the best burgers in town!  Sign up for the free burger on your birthday, that's one way to try something new!
Can't go wrong with any of the burgers.

Bad Daddy's is a lively, popular burger and brew spot. Their burgers are generous and cooked just as you request. I continue to be disappointed in the potatoes. Both fries and tater tots have a seasoning that masks good earthy potato flavor. Burgers are not as good as Chuck's though service is friendlier.

Called at 6:00pm on Saturday, asked about call ahead seating. Was told "they dont do that but they'd write my name down and it was an hour wait". We agreed, drove 30 min to the restaurant. Hostess tells us when we get there it would still be an hour wait and they shouldnt have written my name down.
We wait...
My husband, a friend, and I ate lunch here last Saturday. Was as good as to be expected. Delishes burgers!! My husband wasnt that impressed with his but mine - blown away! And the tater tots!!!

Looking for something to eat prior to a hockey game and this came up on TripAdvisor. Bitter cold and there is nowhere at all to wait inside this very small restaurant. There were two other couples ahead of us and we were all seated at practically the same time. Our 20 minute wait was maybe 10 minutes. Server was at...

If you like a big hearty burger then this is the place. The fried bacon burger is enormous. When you see it the first thing you think is, "How am I gonna bite that?". It's that big. On a nice day the patio is the place to be.
It is very simple.

The burgers are great. The salads are great. I love the food, but we can only patronize this place during the summer, when we can sit outside. The restaurant is *ridiculously* loud. Immensely loud. Loud beyond what you think is possibly conceivable. The owner keeps the music blasting, and the dining room is all hard surfaces and windows and overhead plumbing/piping. You can't have a conversation without screaming at your companions. You don't calmly order, it's more shouting and gesturing and hoping you've been understood.

Definitely some of the best burgers you can get in Raleigh! Compared to other places in town, these burgers will definitely fill you up. They are not fooling around with tiny patties here! Their customization is awesome with a variety of cheese, toppings, and patty options including beef, bison, turkey, chicken, and black bean.

So I tried out this location after having two less than stellar trips to the one in Morrisville and having Cov reach out to me. This location gets 5/5 stars! Our server, Devonta, was top notch. Attentive, friendly, and not too hovering but not absent if we needed anything. I had Mama Ricotta's burger and it was great!! My fianc had Nick's patty melt and it was super! I know what I'm getting next time. :) we had sweet potato friends (probably the best sweet potato fries I've had in Raleigh) and tater tots. We also had pickle chips to start. The pickle chips were sooooooooooo good! They were large slices of pickles instead of the tiny little quarter sized pickles that get mushy. The location is a nice space, not too cramped and TVs everywhere. There's also a great outdoor patio area. One of my favorite things about Bad Daddy's is the huge selection of craft beers they have on tap. You cannot go wrong!!! This is a great place to munch and drink with friends. I can't wait to visit again and try their milkshakes (the table next to us got one and it looked so amazing) and other burgers :)

I ate here for the first time today and it was amazing! The burgers where good and the services just as good. It's so hard to find great food and service now days. The owner even came and checked on our food. I am so glad we tried this place out l. We will definitely be back!
We loved our shrimp and duck appetizer, duck entree and creme brulee, but everything our friends had looked amazing as Well.
Great restaurant and great atmosphere great service great food! !!!
Chef's Table was awesome but not worth the money.
Everything was great.  The salmon pave, the braised lamb shank and the baked Alaska.  Knowledgeable and friendly staff.
fried green tomato salad!

We have dined here several times both as a couple and with friends. We always eat in the 'pub' downstairs where we are able to order from both the pub and the restaurant menus.
The staff is phenomenal. The wine list is amazing (this is one of the few local restaurants where a White Burgundy is offered by the glass)....

This restaurant has received much high praise, and deservedly so.
I had eaten before in the downstairs Tavern part of the restaurant --less formal and a bit less expensive--but this time my husband and I enjoyed the upstairs dining room (actually there's more than one, since it was created from a Victorian house).
The service by two waiters was gracious...

My wife and I attended a Christmas dinner for her regional team at Second Empire, and it was very nicely done, with very good food and drink. It was an abbreviated menu, but everyone seemed pleased with the options. I had a filet that was one of the best I have ever had. Overall, it was a very positive experience....

I came across Second Empire while researching Raleigh restaurants here on Trip Advisor. The glowing reviews were spot-on, and my three colleagues and I enjoyed a truly top-notch dinner. I made reservations on Open Table and thus we were seated in the upstairs portion (the house), as it seems you need to specially request seating in the Tavern, which also...

This is a wonderful place for a celebration or occasion. We're often put off by fine dining and are let down by over-finery and frivolities that often have little substance, this place is not that place. The food is expertly prepared, layers of flavors, and portions that don't leave you asking for extra bread to fill the void so common...

I first heard of second empire when researching what to do for my wife's birthday/Valentine's Day. Her birthday is February 11th and Valentine's Day is the 14th. I knew I wanted to take her somewhere upscale. Upon searching, I saw that second empire seemed like the perfect location for special occasions. They absolutely did not disappoint!

My husband and I celebrated our anniversary here. I was blown away by the service and food. We made a reservation a few days prior to coming and we couldn't of picked a better place. I found the place to be so charming and romantic. When we were seated we found a special menu wishing us a happy anniversary that was signed by the chef with a sweet message.

My dinner in the Second Empire Tavern felt like a throwback to the occasional fancy family dinners of my childhood. It seemed to be, for the most part, a mature, wealthy crowd and atmosphere cozy and candle-lit.

Wow! Delicious food. Every course was amazing. The decor was almost as great as the food. This is one of the best all around restaurants in Raleigh. Not a place I can afford to eat at daily but on special occasions this is my go to spot!

I had never visited this establishment until this weekend when I took my date (to celebrate her birthday) and it was a great experience. Parking was available at the street level, but there were ample spaces available at nearby buildings reserved for Second Empire customers.
Everything I ever had was delicious!! Chef Gloria puts her all into everything she makes. All ingredients are fresh and the delivery is awesome
Excellent food. Must go
Aji de gallina was absolutely delicious!!!
My favorite Raleigh restaurant. Eat all of the delicious foods.  Ask the chef to surprise you.
Try the Jalea and the Ceviche Trio.

You really wouldn't expect food this good in a city the size of Raleigh, especially at the end of a strip mall but Machu Picchu is world class food: better than the world-renowned dream restaurants.
Bright and small, it doesn't meet any of your expectations until the food arrives. The Chorillana (Pescado a la Chorillana) is consistently the best meal...

I highly recommend Machu Pichu for any occasion where you want to impress your love ones. This has been so far the best culinary experience me and my husband have had and we have tried many. The food is unbelievable good and fresh, the presentation of their plates are so beautiful, the service is outstanding, the restaurant is so clean,...

Have visited here twice and both times were fantastic. Food is reasonably priced, service decent and meals delicious. Had never had Peruvian food prior to visiting here and am a now a fan! The tacu taco offering came with perfectly prepared beef and a small nerf football-sized combo of rice and beans-the tacu tacu. Delicious! My wife had one of...
Very good! First time here and we were impressed! Excellent service and excellent food! Definitely be back :)! Love Peruvian food!

The place is very clean and the staff smily and proper.
Had very nice appetizers with chicha. The lomo and aji de camarones that followed were wonderful!
The only "bad" part of the experience, is that we did not had desert. queda pendiente for next visit
On the door there is a sign that says "reservations strongly recommended," and this only speaks to their popularity and superb cuisine (and possibly small dining area).
This was a really strange experience.
Very good. Original, Unique and nothing like it in Raleigh. My only complaint is lunch is closed M-Th.

We returned to Machu Pichu today to celebrate my son's birthday. Again, everything was outstanding, the food, the service, the environment. We started with a Peruvian tamal that has been the best tamal we have ever had, very very different from the Central American tamal or from the Cuban tamal. We also had escabeche Peruvian scallops, this scallops were extraordinary! We ordered Jalea for two, Mahi-Mahi with peruvian salad and quinoa (the quinoa tasted sooo good, it had peas and carrots, like a Peruvian Chaufa but without the calories of the rice and the salad very yummy) I ordered the lomo salteado with Pacu (lomo salteado is filet mignon saut with peppers and tomatoes and Pacu is a rice mixed with a Peruvian type of beans that is soo delicious). Its impossible to go wrong with any entree here at Machu Pichu, everything is just unbelievable great. Desserts were Tiramisu, Peruvian rice pudding and flan de coco (coconut custard) I cannot choose which one was the best because they were all delicious. Thanks to Chef Gloria for decorating our son's dessert for his celebration. Cant wait to be back for dinner! Sorry I only took a picture of the dessert. We were pigging out so badly that we did not even mind to take pictures of our entrees!
In the interest of full disclosure let me preface my review with the fact that I left Machu Picchu before my entre arrived but after the chef/owner was rude enough to my wife to make her cry.
Some of the best baby back ribs I've had in a while! Also super yummy catfish and a very tasty IPA! On top of that, very good service and super hip ambiance! A must!
Valet parking and great food
Pulled pork was maybe a little dry, brisket wasn't
Brisket and ribs are good.Good to see my old neighborhood alive and well.
Get the cornbread.

We are new to NC and had received several recommendations for The Pit so we took some visiting friends to try it out with us last Sunday evening and was excited to show them some good NC bbq. The complimentary parking, facility, service, biscuits, hushpuppies, sweet tea, and banana pudding were great. Was very disappointed in what I ordered -...

We enjoy taking out of town guest to The Pit. Great BBQ plus a nice location and Valet parking.Great selection of BBQ,salads and a few veggie options. Service is always excellent. It's a cute street "The warehouse district" Crank Arm Brewery is across the street and few other restaurants so nice to walk around after dinner.

Stopped here to try my first southern ribs and they were delicious! They didn't use the usual southern bbq sauce (vinegar) so I liked the thicker kind. Sat at the bar and both bartenders were very attentive and talkative. Tried a Weeping Willow Wit beer which was delicious. Wasn't crazy about how the place was set up... Usually the bar...

Visited this place 3 times when I was in downtown Raleigh, but I honestly don't see what's so special about their pulled pork sandwich. It feels like it got no taste at all, and that's why restaurant offers many sauces. the pit serve mostly local beers, and I honestly can't drink any of them, hopefully the pit would regular stuff...

We used to live in Raleigh and loved the hot, spicy NC barbeque. The pork here is tender and tasty. The additional crushed red peppers marinated in vinegar mixture allowed me top crank up the heat to where I liked it. I'll go there agin if I'm back in Raleigh in the future. Wait staff was friendly and efficient.

Recently had the pleasure of enjoying an evening with friends at the Pit. Fortunately we had a reservation as the place was packed. We were quickly seated, and our server, Jerry, and his team, were excellent! They were attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly.
The food is fantastic and they have the best set up for service - each section has multiple servers that are all helpful and very quick!
I had a fantastic lunch here today! Andy, the barman, made me a whiskey Mint Julep that was spot on and tasty. The Carolina ribs and BBQ soul rolls were awesome.

I knew my nephew was going to order ribs, and since I wanted to consume as many BBQ meats possible on this trip, I decided to treat myself to the double meat combo with brisket and pulled pork. Overall, the brisket was good, but considering all the accolades regarding The Pit, it did not meet expectations. The ribs faired about the same. A little more time on the smoker was needed as the meat was slightly undercooked. I believe this is what led to the lack of flavor other than the sauce, my nephew, slathered on top of it. As for the pulled pork, it was the better of all three but nothing really notable. The meat was tender and moist, and the taste was pretty good. I initially was not ecstatic with the portion sizes but in hindsight, I really didn't miss anything.
Wow. This'll be short. I am thoroughly satisfied. My BBQ craving is finally smitten. I am satiated and gratified.
The foi gras is excelent and the short ribs is a most!
Delicioso. Excelent food, excelent service, excelent ambiance.
The foi feas is excelen, And the short rib superb!!! The service with out iqual!! Totally recomended.
Great food, great service, great ambiance. Not cheap, but great!
Save room for dessert. "Single Chocolate Ball of Dream". Seriously, save room for dessert.

Our server was wonderful. She was friendly and on time, and we never had to ask for anything. The speed of the meal itself, kitchen staff wise, was rather slow. I've been to many fine dining establishments, and I do feel as if this was one of the slowest ever. I expected the presentation to be spectacular, but it was...

We were invited to dinner by some new friends who were over the moon about St Jacques. We were excited to go, this restaurant had been on our list for quite some time. Our experience wasn't bad, but we found it to not be a very good value for the money. The service was impeccable, great wait staff. The deco...

St Jacques is one of a few restaurants we dine at for special occasions. We never have a bad meal. Tonight's meal was not quite up to the restaurant's normally high standards. The service was not as professional as we have come to expect and it was very slow although there were several empty tables. I started with the onion...

I am even more impressed with Saint Jacques after my second visit. This last time I went for lunch. The service is impeccable as the staff makes sure that you are always taken care of and go out of their way to make sure you are treated well.
I ordered the boeuf bourguignon that was on polenta. The flavors were...

The French onion soup had a very sweet taste, was luke warm and not good. After that it took about an hour for us to get our entree and it was just ok. Very pricey.$$$$$$$
I don't think we'll be going back anytime soon.
We came to St. Jacques on my parent's final trip up the East Coast as they retire to France. They had been here many times and had regaled me with how wonderful this place was.

Oh Saint Jacques....overall I'm a fan. I'll cut to the chase though: there's no excuse for room temperature, if not colder, main courses. It's the reason I can't give this place 5 stars: it loses a star for cold food. But I loved so much about it, hence 4 stars!

I had an amazing dining experience at Saint Jacques on Mothers Day. The service was absolutely incredible and flawless. There was so much attention to detail in how the food was served and how each course was properly prepped for. It was definitely some of the best service I've ever had from a high end restaurant. For Mother's Day, there was a three course meal for $55 a person. I chose the French onion soup, braised short rib, and chocolate raspberry marquise. Overall, the food was amazing with great depths of flavor in each course. Although French food is known to come in small portions, I was very full after the three courses.
Excellent food, service and ambience. Very cozy atmosphere, great spot for a romantic dinner. Will definitely be back again soon!

Saint Jacques is one of the most elegant restaurants in the Triangle, providing a beautiful dining experience. The top notch French cuisine is served leisurely in small portions that are extremely tasty. Every dish is a complementary combination of ingredients and seasonings. The sommelier is very knowledgeable and helpful with suggested wine pairings but not pushy or condescending. The indulgent service, provided by multiple waiters for a single table, is warm and unobtrusive. The decor sparkles with pressed white tablecloths and polished flatware. Reservations are definitely recommended, though may not be needed on weeknights.
